poem:
Title: "In Praise of the Weathered Earth"

O California, cupped
in the burning palm of change,
The times, they thrum and hum -
behold man's estranged dance.
Rising gas, chattering gust,
circulation patterns in disarray.
Truth whispers on the westward wind,
the sky's banner dyed a different hue.
See, on the frontline of decay,
man looks upon his making, afraid.
